column3:
Removing a pair of `{}` causes Clang 5 to fire a false warning:
```
qt/sendcoinsdialog.cpp:38:41: warning: suggest braces around initialization of subobject [-Wmissing-braces]
static constexpr std::array confTargets{2, 4, 6, 12, 24, 48, 144, 504, 1008};
                                        ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
                                        {
Indeed, this is not the only place. And generally, we don't maim our code to accommodate archaic and broken compilers.

Not related to this PR, but we use [Clang 5](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/ci/test/00_setup_env_native_nowallet.sh) in CI with `--enable-werror` now.\nThe only reason why CI passes is #18092.
> And generally, we don't maim our code to accommodate archaic and broken compilers.\n\nBut we do accommodate our build system :)
Yes, the build system can disable werror for clang-5, if werror for clang-5 is broken

> Yes, the build system can disable werror for clang-5, if werror for clang-5 is broken\n\n#20544 it its recent [reincarnation](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20544#issuecomment-738977767).
